models.conversations: A conversation represents a thread of communication between the two parents, which can contain regular messages or permission requests.
models.messages: A communication between parents with threading support. All messages are timestamped and logged for record-keeping.
models.permissionRequests: A formal request for approval on decisions like activities, schedule exceptions, or special purchases. Has a status (pending, approved, denied) and resolution history.

relationships: Each Conversation contains multiple Messages or a PermissionRequest
Messages belong to a Conversation and are sent by one Parent
PermissionRequests belong to a Conversation, created by one Parent and resolved by the other

permissionRequest.description: I'd like to register Emma for the summer soccer camp at Riverside Sports Complex. It runs June 12-23, Monday through Friday 9am-3pm. Cost is $450 which includes lunch and a uniform.
Would like to take Emma to visit my parents in Portland for spring break (March 18-25). We'd fly out Saturday morning and return Sunday evening. My parents haven't seen her since Thanksgiving.
permissionRequest.response: Approved. Please share the flight details when you have them. Have a great trip!

permissionRequest.description: Need to pick up Emma at 2pm this Friday instead of the usual 5pm. I have a work conflict that came up and need to drop her at my sister's before heading to the airport.
permissionRequest.response: I have an important meeting until 3pm on Friday and won't be able to accommodate an early pickup. Can your sister pick her up from school at the regular time instead?

messages.content: Hey, got the reminder about Emma's parent-teacher conference next Thursday at 4pm. Are you planning to attend?
Yes, I already marked it on my calendar. Ms. Rodriguez mentioned she wanted to discuss Emma's reading progress. Should be good news - Emma's been doing really well with her homework.
Great! I'll meet you there. Looking forward to hearing about her progress.
Quick heads up - I updated my work number in Emma's school records. New direct line is (555) 234-5678. Can you update it in your contacts too?
Got it, updated. Thanks for letting me know.

permissionRequest.description: Dr. Chen recommended allergy testing for Emma given her recent reactions to certain foods. The pediatric allergist has an opening next Tuesday at 10am. It's a skin test that takes about an hour.
permissionRequest.response: Yes, please go ahead and schedule it. I've been worried about those reactions too. Let me know what they find out.

messages.content: Emma got invited to Sophie's birthday party this Saturday 2-4pm at the trampoline park. I already RSVP'd yes since it's during my time. Just wanted to give you a heads up.
Sounds fun! Does she need a gift?
I'll take care of it - picking up an art set tomorrow. Sophie's really into painting lately.
Don't forget Emma's antibiotic needs to be taken twice daily with food. She had her morning dose at 7:30am. Next one should be around 7:30pm tonight.
Thanks for the reminder. I have it marked on my calendar. She's been good about taking it so far.
